member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.Authentication
member.summary: The abstract base class for all authentication classes.
member.example: sets the AuthenticationToken header element for the corresponding service client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Authentication.SetAuthenticationFieldsOnApiRequestObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the required SOAP header elements for the corresponding Bing Ads service operation.
member.param: The Bing Ads service operation request object. For example, this object can be the GetUserRequest message of the GetUser service operation.
member.remarks: The header elements that the method sets will differ depending on the type of authentication. For example if you use one of the OAuth classes, the AuthenticationToken header will be set by this method, whereas the UserName and Password headers will remain empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Authentication.AddAuthenticationHeaders(System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpRequestHeaders)
member.summary: Adds the required http headers elements for the corresponding bulk file upload operation.
member.param: The headers collection to which authentication requests should be added.
member.remarks: The header elements that the method sets will differ depending on the type of authentication. For example if you use one of the OAuth classes, the AuthenticationToken header will be set by this method, whereas the UserName and Password headers will remain empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthWithAuthorizationCode.RequestAccessAndRefreshTokensAsync(System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}})
member.summary: Retrieves OAuth access and refresh tokens from the Microsoft Account authorization service using the specified authorization response redirect .
member.param: The authorization response redirect that contains the authorization code.
member.remarks: For more information, see Authorization Response section in the OAuth 2.0 spec.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result will be an object.
member.exception: Thrown if tokens can't be received due to an error received from the Microsoft Account authorization server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthWithAuthorizationCode.RequestAccessAndRefreshTokensAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.String}})
member.summary: Retrieves OAuth access and refresh tokens from the Microsoft Account authorization service using the specified refresh token.
member.param: The refresh token used to request new access and refresh tokens.
member.remarks: For more information, see Refreshing an Access Token section in the OAuth 2.0 spec.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result will be an object.
member.exception: Thrown if tokens can't be received due to an error received from the Microsoft Account authorization server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.Internal.OAuthWithAuthorizationCode.RefreshAccessTokenAsync
member.summary: Retrieves OAuth tokens from authorization server using the last known refresh token from the current session.
member.returns: OAuth tokens
member.remarks: When the current access token expires, it needs to be refreshed. It can be refreshed using the refresh token that was receive before (either provided directly by user or retrieved using the authorization code). The detects access token expiration and calls this method to refresh it.
member.exception: Thrown if tokens can't be received.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.PasswordAuthentication
member.summary: Represents a legacy Bing Ads authentication method using user name and password.

remarks.para: You can use an instance of this class as the Authentication property of a object to authenticate with Bing Ads services.

Existing users with legacy Bing Ads credentials may continue to specify the UserName and Password header elements. In future versions of the API, Bing Ads will transition exclusively to Microsoft Account authentication. New customers are required to sign up for Bing Ads with a Microsoft Account, and to manage those accounts you must use OAuth. For example instead of using this PasswordAuthentication class, you would authenticate with an instance of either , , or .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PasswordAuthentication class using the specified user name and password.
member.param: The Bing Ads user's sign-in user name. You may not set this element to a Microsoft account.
The Bing Ads user's sign-in password.

member.remarks: For example, can be the GetUserRequest message of the GetUser service operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.AdInsight.MatchType
member.summary: Defines the possible keyword match type values.
member.remarks:
See MatchType Value Set https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/ad-insight-service/matchtype?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by , , , , and data objects.
Used by GetEstimatedPositionByKeywords and GetHistoricalKeywordPerformance service operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.AdInsight.MatchType.Exact
member.summary: An exact match results when all of the words in the keyword exactly match the user's search query.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.AdInsight.MatchType.Phrase
member.summary: A phrase match results when all of the words in the keyword are present in the user's search query and are in the same order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.AdInsight.MatchType.Broad
member.summary: A broad match results when words in the keyword are present in the user's search query; however, the word order can vary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.AdInsight.MatchType.Aggregate
member.summary: Aggregates the data across all match types.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.BulkDownloadOperation
member.summary: Represents a bulk download operation requested by a user. You can use this class to poll for the download status, and then download the file when available.
member.example: The method returns an instance of this class. If for any reason you do not want to wait for the file to be prepared for download, for example if your application quits unexpectedly or you have other tasks to process, you can use an instance of to download the file when it is available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.BulkServiceManager
member.summary: Provides high level methods for uploading and downloading entities using the Bulk API functionality. Also provides methods for submitting upload or download operations.
member.remarks: will submit the download request to the bulk service, poll until the status is completed (or returns an error), and downloads the file locally. If instead you want to manage the low level details you would first call , wait for the results file to be prepared using either or , and then download the file with the method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.BulkUploadOperation
member.summary: Represents a bulk upload operation requested by a user. You can use this class to poll for the upload status, and then download the upload results file when available.
member.example: The method returns an instance of this class. If for any reason you do not want to wait for the file to finish uploading, for example if your application quits unexpectedly or you have other tasks to process, you can use an instance of to download the upload results file when it is available.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters
member.summary: Describes the available parameters when submitting a file for upload, such as the type of entities and data scope that you want to download.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.DataScope
member.summary: The scope or types of data to download. For possible values, see DataScope Value Set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.DownloadEntities
member.summary: The type of entities to download. For possible values, see BulkDownloadEntity Value Set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.FileType
member.summary: The extension type of the downloaded file. For possible values, see DownloadFileType Value Set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.CampaignIds
member.summary: The campaigns to download. You can specify a maximum of 1,000 campaigns. The campaigns that you specify must belong to the same account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.LastSyncTimeInUTC
member.summary: The last time that you requested a download. The date and time is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Typically, you request a full download the first time you call the operation by setting this element to null. On all subsequent calls you set the last sync time to the time stamp of the previous download. The download file contains the time stamp of the download in the SyncTime column of the Account record. Use the time stamp to set LastSyncTimeInUTC the next time that you request a download. If you specify the last sync time, only those entities that have changed (been updated or deleted) since the specified date and time will be downloaded. However, if the campaign data has not been previously downloaded, the operation performs a full download.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.ResultFileDirectory
member.summary: The directory where the file will be downloaded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.ResultFileName
member.summary: The name of the download result file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadParameters.OverwriteResultFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the local result file should be overwritten if it already exists.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values of the bulk download.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The default Unknown status.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadStatus.Completed
member.summary: The download completed successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadStatus.InProgress
member.summary: The download is in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadStatus.Failed
member.summary: The download failed. You may submit a new download with fewer entities, without performance data, or try again to submit the same download later.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.DownloadStatus.FailedFullSyncRequired
member.summary: The last sync time must be null. The request's LastSyncTimeInUTC element must be set to null if the specified account was included in a data migration, for example the URL by match type migration. After requesting a full download, you may begin requesting delta downloads again.

member.summary: The best position, main line, and first page bid suggestion data corresponding to one keyword. If the requested includes BidSuggestionsData, the download will include bulk records corresponding to the properties of this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.Entities.BidSuggestionData.BestPosition
member.summary: Represents a best position bid suggestion that is derived from and can only be read from a bulk file by the when reading the corresponding . An instance of this class can represent a single best position bid, and thus one record in the bulk file. Properties of this class and of classes that it is derived from, correspond to fields of the Keyword Best Position Bid record in a bulk file. For more information, see Keyword Best Position Bid.

Properties of this class and of classes that it is derived from, correspond to fields of the Keyword Main Line Bid record in a bulk file. For more information, see Keyword Main Line Bid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.Entities.BulkError
member.summary: Contains bulk file error details in a seperate record that corresponds to the record of a derived instance. Properties of this class and of classes that it is derived from, correspond to error fields of the 'Error' records in a bulk file. For more information, see Bulk File Schema.
member.example: If you upload a without setting the campaign name using , and if you request errors to be returned in the results using the corresponding , then the upload result file will contain a record that can be read with a as an instance of .

member.summary: The error code, for example 'CampaignServiceEditorialValidationError'. Corresponds to the 'Error' field in the bulk file. For more information, see Bing Ads Operation Error Codes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.Entities.BulkError.Number
member.summary: The error number, for example '1042'. Corresponds to the 'Error Number' field in the bulk file. For more information, see Bing Ads Operation Error Codes.

member.summary: The field path of the error. Corresponds to the 'Field Path' field in the bulk file.

member.summary: The result file represents the full sync of entities that were specified in the download request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.ResultFileType.PartialDownload
member.summary: The result file represents the partial sync of entities that were specified in the download request.

member.summary: Describes the service request parameters such as the type of entities and data scope that you want to download.

member.summary: The scope or types of data to download. For possible values, see DataScope Value Set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.SubmitDownloadParameters.DownloadEntities
member.summary: The entities to download

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.SubmitDownloadParameters.FileType
member.summary: The extension type of the downloaded file. For possible values, see DownloadFileType Value Set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.SubmitDownloadParameters.CampaignIds
member.summary: The campaigns to download. You can specify a maximum of 1,000 campaigns. The campaigns that you specify must belong to the same account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.SubmitDownloadParameters.LastSyncTimeInUTC
member.summary: The last time that you requested a download. The date and time is expressed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Typically, you request a full download the first time you call the operation by setting this element to null. On all subsequent calls you set the last sync time to the time stamp of the previous download. The download file contains the time stamp of the download in the SyncTime column of the Account record. Use the time stamp to set LastSyncTimeInUTC the next time that you request a download. If you specify the last sync time, only those entities that have changed (been updated or deleted) since the specified date and time will be downloaded. However, if the campaign data has not been previously downloaded, the operation performs a full download.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values of the bulk upload.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.Completed
member.summary: The upload completed with one or more errors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.CompletedWithErrors
member.summary: The upload completed with one or more errors. While the overall upload was successful, one or more add or update errors could have occurred. As a best practice you should request error information via the element when calling the upload service and check the result file for any errors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.Failed
member.summary: The entire upload failed due to an unexpected error. You may submit a new upload with fewer entities or try again to submit the same upload later.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.FileUploaded
member.summary: The upload request has been received and is in the queue for processing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.InProgress
member.summary: The upload file has been accepted and the upload is in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.PendingFileUpload
member.summary: The upload file has not been received for the corresponding RequestId.

member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Bulk.UploadStatus.Expired
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CampaignManagement.ImageAsset.CropHeight
member.summary: The number of pixels to use from the image asset source, starting from the CropY position and moving upwards.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CampaignManagement.ImageAsset.CropWidth
member.summary: The number of pixels to use from the image asset source, starting from the CropX position and moving to the right.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CampaignManagement.ImageAsset.CropX
member.summary: Starting from the lower left corner of image asset source, this is the number of pixels to skip to the right on the x-axis before applying the CropWidth.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CampaignManagement.ImageAsset.CropY
member.summary: Starting from the lower left corner of image asset source, this is the number of pixels to skip upwards on the y-axis before applying the CropHeight.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible financial status values of an account.
member.remarks:
See AccountFinancialStatus Value Set https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/customer-management-service/accountfinancialstatus?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.Proposed
member.summary: For an advertiser account, this status indicates that the customer can add campaigns to the account; however, the service will not deliver the account's ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.PendingCreditCheck
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.ClearFinancialStatus
member.summary: The account is in good standing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.SoldToOnly
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.CreditWarning
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.Hold
member.summary: For an advertiser account, this status indicates that the account is past due.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.WriteOff
member.summary: The account is past due; however, collection is no longer being pursued.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.TaxOnHold
member.summary: For a publisher account, this status indicates that the publisher has yet to provide a valid tax instrument.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AccountFinancialStatus.UserHold
member.summary: For a publisher account, this status indicates that the payout to the publisher was placed on hold by publisher.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType
member.summary: Defines possible payment methods for a Microsoft Advertising account.
member.remarks:
See PaymentMethodType Value Set https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/customer-management-service/paymentmethodtype?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.CreditCard
member.summary: The payments are made with a credit card.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.Invoice
member.summary: An invoice is sent to the customer requesting payment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.Check
member.summary: The payments are made with a check.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.ElectronicFundsTransfer
member.summary: The payments are made with an electronic funds transfer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.PayPal
member.summary: A payment service that allows customers to pay for their Microsoft Advertising transactions online.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.ELV
member.summary: The ELV value represents the SEPA payment method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.OfflinePaymentMethod
member.summary: Meant to signal when a customer is funding a prepay account by making payment via a check or a bank transfer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.VBA
member.summary: Virtual Bank Account is a form of payment used widely in Taiwan.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.PaymentMethodType.Boleto
member.summary: Boleto is a form of payment used widely in Brazil.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.CustomerInfo
member.summary: Defines an object that contains a customer's identifier and name.
member.remarks:

Used by data object.
Used by GetCustomersInfo and GetLinkedAccountsAndCustomersInfo service operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.CustomerInfo.Id
member.summary: The system-generated identifier of the customer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.CustomerInfo.Name
member.summary: The name of the customer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AutoTagType
member.summary: Defines possible values for an account level setting that determines whether to append or replace the supported UTM tracking codes.
member.remarks:
See AutoTagType Value Set https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/customer-management-service/autotagtype?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AutoTagType.Inactive
member.summary: Microsoft Advertising will not append any UTM tracking codes to your ad or keyword final URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AutoTagType.Preserve
member.summary: Microsoft Advertising will automatically append the supported UTM tracking codes, and preserve any existing UTM tracking codes that you added to your ad or keyword's final URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.AutoTagType.Replace
member.summary: Microsoft Advertising will automatically append the supported UTM tracking codes, and replace any of the existing and supported UTM tracking codes that you added to your ad or keyword's final URL.

member.summary: The date when the status would update.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.SuppressNotification
member.summary: Determines whether or not to send email notification of the client link invitation to the primary user of the client advertiser account.

member.summary: The date and time that the client link was last updated.

member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.ForwardCompatibilityMap

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLink.CustomerLinkPermission
member.summary: Determines whether the user's access to the accounts is restricted by customer hierarchy i.e., customer level client linking.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus
member.summary: Defines the possible status values of a ClientLink.
member.remarks:
See ClientLinkStatus Value Set https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/customer-management-service/clientlinkstatus?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkPending
member.summary: The ClientLink has been added via the AddClientLinks operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkCanceled
member.summary: The link request has been canceled by the agency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkExpired
member.summary: The link is inactive due to expiry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkAccepted
member.summary: The invited client should use this value to accept the link invitation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkDeclined
member.summary: The link request has been declined by the invited client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkInProgress
member.summary: The link process is in progress and either waiting for the billing transition to complete or the specified client link start date has not yet arrived.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.Active
member.summary: The link is established and the managing customer can access the client account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.LinkFailed
member.summary: The link process failed to complete successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkRequested
member.summary: The agency should use this value to request an unlink.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkPending
member.summary: A request to terminate the link has been sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkCanceled
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkInProgress
member.summary: The unlink process is in progress and waiting for the billing transition to complete.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.Inactive
member.summary: The unlink process has completed and the managing customer can no longer access the client account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.CustomerManagement.ClientLinkStatus.UnlinkFailed
member.summary: The unlink process failed to complete successfully, for example because the billing transition could not be completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter
member.summary: Defines the criteria to use to filter the campaign performance report data.
member.remarks:
See CampaignPerformanceReportFilter Data Object https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/reporting-service/campaignperformancereportfilter?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by data object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.AccountStatus
member.summary: The report will include data for only the account status.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.AdDistribution
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified distribution medium.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceOS
member.summary: The report will include data where the ad is displayed on the specified device operating systems.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.DeviceType
member.summary: The report will include data where the ad is displayed on the specified device types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportFilter.Status
member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified campaign status values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.AccountThroughCampaignReportScope
member.summary: Defines the set of accounts and campaigns to include in the report.
member.remarks:
See AccountThroughCampaignReportScope Data Object https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/advertising/reporting-service/accountthroughcampaignreportscope?view=bingads-13 for details.
Used by and data objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.AccountThroughCampaignReportScope.AccountIds
member.summary: A list of up to 1,000 account identifiers to include in the report.

member.name: P:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.AccountThroughCampaignReportScope.Campaigns
member.summary: A list of up to 300 campaigns to include in the report.

member.summary: The network where you want your ads to show.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Impressions
member.summary: The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Clicks
member.summary: Clicks are what you pay for.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Ctr
member.summary: The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).

member.summary: The average cost per click (CPC).

member.summary: The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AveragePosition
member.summary: The average position of the ad on a webpage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Conversions
member.summary: The number of conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ConversionRate
member.summary: The conversion rate as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerConversion
member.summary: The cost per conversion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityClicks
member.summary: Clicks that exhibit a low likelihood of commercial intent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityClicksPercent
member.summary: The low-quality clicks as a percentage.

member.summary: The number of impressions that result from low-quality keyword searches.

member.summary: The low-quality impressions as a percentage.

member.summary: The number of conversions that originate from low-quality clicks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityConversionRate
member.summary: The low-quality conversion rate as a percentage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceType
member.summary: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.DeviceOS
member.summary: The operating system of the device reported in the DeviceType column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of impressions, out of the total available impressions in the market you were targeting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of impressions your ad did not receive due to issues with your daily or monthly budget.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ImpressionLostToRankAggPercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of impressions your ad did not receive due to issues with your ad ranking.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.QualityScore
member.summary: The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ExpectedCtr
member.summary: How well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AdRelevance
member.summary: How closely related your ads is to the customer's search query or other input.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LandingPageExperience
member.summary: An aggregate quality assessment of all landing pages on your site.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricalQualityScore
member.summary: The historical quality score for each row is the value that was calculated for quality score on that date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricalExpectedCtr
member.summary: Historical average of expected click-through rate scores going back as far as 18 months from the current date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricalAdRelevance
member.summary: Historical average of ad relevance scores back as far as 18 months from the current date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.HistoricalLandingPageExperience
member.summary: Historical average of landing page experience scores back as far as 18 months from the current date.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneImpressions
member.summary: The number of times your tracked number was shown on all devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.PhoneCalls
member.summary: The number of total calls to the tracked phone number that showed with your ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Ptr
member.summary: The phone-through rate (Ptr).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Network
member.summary: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TopVsOther
member.summary: Indicates whether the ad impression appeared in a top position or elsewhere.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.BidMatchType
member.summary: The keyword bid match type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.DeliveredMatchType
member.summary: The match type used to deliver an ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Assists
member.summary: The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.Revenue
member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ReturnOnAdSpend
member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CostPerAssist
member.summary: The cost per assist.

member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.summary: The revenue per assist.

member.summary: The current tracking template for the campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CustomParameters
member.summary: The current set of custom parameters for the campaign.

member.summary: The account status.

member.summary: The name of the budget.

member.summary: The budget status.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.BudgetAssociationStatus
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the campaign is currently spending from the budget mentioned in the BudgetName column.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualityGeneralClicks
member.summary: Clicks that are filtered by general methods, such as deny lists and activity-based detection, and that exhibit a low likelihood of commercial intent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.LowQualitySophisticatedClicks
member.summary: Invalid clicks that use sophisticated means to appear valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignLabels
member.summary: The labels applied to the campaign.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ExactMatchImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of impressions that your account received for searches that exactly matched your keyword, out of the total available exact match impressions you were eligible to receive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CustomerId
member.summary: The Microsoft Advertising assigned identifier of a customer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CustomerName
member.summary: The customer name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.ClickSharePercent
member.summary: The percentage of clicks that went to your ads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AbsoluteTopImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of times your ad was in the first position of all results, out of the estimated number of first position impressions you were eligible to receive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.FinalUrlSuffix
member.summary: A place in your final URL where you can add parameters that will be attached to the end of your landing page URL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.CampaignType
member.summary: The campaign type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TopImpressionShareLostToRankPercent
member.summary: A percentage estimate of how often poor ad rank kept your ad from showing in the mainline, the top ad placements above the search results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TopImpressionShareLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of mainline impressions, where ads appear above the search results, that were lost due to insufficient budget.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AbsoluteTopImpressionShareLostToRankPercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of how often poor ad rank kept your ad from showing in the first ad position at the top of search results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AbsoluteTopImpressionShareLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The estimated percentage of how often your ad missed showing in the very top ad position, above search results, due to insufficient budget.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TopImpressionSharePercent
member.summary: The percentage of impressions for your ad in the mainline, the top ad placements above the search results, out of the estimated number of mainline impressions you were eligible to receive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AbsoluteTopImpressionRatePercent
member.summary: How often your ad was in the first position of all results, as a percentage of your total impressions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.TopImpressionRatePercent
member.summary: The percentage of times your ad showed in the mainline, the top placement where ads appear above the search results, out of your total impressions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.BaseCampaignId
member.summary: The Microsoft Advertising assigned identifier of an experiment campaign.

member.summary: The number of conversions.

member.summary: The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.

member.summary: The return on ad spend (ROAS).

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AllRevenuePerConversion
member.summary: The revenue per conversion.

member.summary: The name of the goal you set for the conversions you want, meaning actions customers take after clicking your ad.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.GoalType
member.summary: The type of conversion goal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AudienceImpressionSharePercent

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AudienceImpressionLostToRankPercent
member.summary: The percentage of impression share you lost due to low rank on the Microsoft Audience Network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.AudienceImpressionLostToBudgetPercent
member.summary: The percentage of impression share you lost due to insufficient budget on the Microsoft Audience Network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.BingAds.V13.Reporting.CampaignPerformanceReportColumn.RelativeCtr
member.summary: Your click-through rate divided by the average click-through rate of all ads that appear in the same sections of websites that show your ads.

member.summary: The total advertising cost divided by the number of impressions (in thousands).

member.summary: The number of conversions.

member.summary: The report will include data for only the account status.

member.summary: The report will include data for only the ad group status.

member.summary: The report will include data for ads that have the specified status value.

member.summary: If the value of this element is set to true, search terms that had one or more ad impressions but resulted in zero clicks in the specified time duration will be excluded from the report.

member.summary: The feed URL will appear either as "True" or "False".

member.summary: The report will include data for only the specified search query strings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.BingAds.ServiceClient`1.CallAsync``2(System.Func{`0,``0,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``1}},``0)
member.summary: Calls the Bing Ads service and returns the response of the corresponding of the Bing Ads service.
member.typeparam: The type of the Bing Ads service request message.
The type of the Bing Ads service response message.
member.param: A delegate representing the Bing Ads service operation that should be called.
The request message object for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result will be the Bing Ads service response.

remarks.para: The header elements that the method sets will differ depending on the type of authentication specified in and the requirements of the service. For example if you use one of the OAuth classes, the AuthenticationToken will be set by this method, whereas the UserName and Password headers will remain empty. Some services such as Customer Management do not accept CustomerId and CustomerAccountId headers, so they will be ignored if you specified them in the object.

If you are using one of the OAuth classes for authentication and the access token has expired (error 109 is returned from the API), this method will try to refresh it using the current refresh token and retry the request with the new access token.

member.exception: Thrown if a fault is returned from the Bing Ads service.
Thrown if tokens can't be refreshed due to an error received from the Microsoft Account authorization server.
